acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.84microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >4,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 4.45mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 510mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.68 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. The reagent (purity: 98%) has the flash point of 100degC (c.c.) according to some reports, which could be "Not classified. "

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro chromosome aberration tests, in vitro reverse mutation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)) and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Cannot be classified though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation with the effects reversible within 4 days, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed according to the Maximization method and OECD TG406 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 28mg/L (22degC, pH6.9) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In repeat dose toxicity studies in animals, cholinesterase inhibition was detected, but no target organs were identified from evidence reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "lacrimation," "convulsions," "salivation," and "reduced motor functions" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
